questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'class' attribute in HTML?
choices: To specify one or more class names for an element
To define a unique id for an element
To specify the type of element
questions.answer: To specify one or more class names for an element

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element?
questions.answer: id

questions.question: What does the 'src' attribute specify?
choices: The URL of the file to embed
The source code of the element
questions.answer: The URL of the file to embed

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define the structure of an HTML document?
questions.answer: <html>

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in the tag?
choices: To provide alternative text for the image
To specify the alignment of the image
To define the size of the image
questions.answer: To provide alternative text for the image

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify inline styles?
questions.answer: style

questions.question: What does the 'href' attribute specify?
choices: The URL of the page the link goes to
questions.answer: The URL of the page the link goes to

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a paragraph?
What is the purpose of the 'target' attribute in the <a> tag?
choices: To specify where to open the linked document
To define the text of the link
To set a target date for the link
To specify the type of link
questions.answer: To specify where to open the linked document

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify an input field should be disabled?
questions.answer: disabled

questions.question: What does the 'colspan' attribute do in table cells?
choices: Specifies how many columns a cell should span
Defines the color of the column
Aligns the content of the column
questions.answer: Specifies how many columns a cell should span

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a header for a document or a section?
questions.answer: <header>

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'type' attribute in the <input> tag?
choices: To specify the type of input element to display
To define the data type of the input
To set the text type for the input
questions.answer: To specify the type of input element to display

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify that an input field must be filled out?
questions.answer: required

questions.question: What does the 'action' attribute specify in a form?
choices: Where to send the form-data when a form is submitted
The type of action to be performed
The animation to play on submission
The validation rules for the form
questions.answer: Where to send the form-data when a form is submitted

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a list item?
questions.answer: <li>

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'placeholder' attribute?
choices: To specify a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field
To define the default value of an input field
To set the maximum length of input
To specify where to place the input field
questions.answer: To specify a short hint that describes the expected value of an input field

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify the character encoding for an HTML document?
questions.answer: charset

questions.question: What does the 'method' attribute specify in a form?
choices: The HTTP method to use when sending form-data
The validation method for the form
The method to display form results
The encryption method for form data
questions.answer: The HTTP method to use when sending form-data

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define emphasized text?
questions.answer: <em>

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'name' attribute in form elements?
choices: To specify a name for the element
To define the type of the element
To set the display name of the element
To create a label for the element
questions.answer: To specify a name for the element

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify extra information about an element?
questions.answer: title

questions.question: What does the 'rel' attribute specify?
choices: The relationship between the current document and the linked document
The relevance of the linked document
The reload time for the link
questions.answer: The relationship between the current document and the linked document

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a section in a document?
questions.answer: <section>

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'value' attribute in input elements?
choices: To specify the initial value of an input element
To set the maximum value allowed
To define the type of value accepted
questions.answer: To specify the initial value of an input element

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify that an element is not yet, or is no longer, relevant?
questions.answer: hidden

questions.question: What does the 'max' attribute do?
choices: Specifies the maximum value for an input field
Sets the maximum width of an element
Defines the maximum number of characters allowed
Limits the maximum number of items in a list
questions.answer: Specifies the maximum value for an input field

questions.question: Which HTML element is used to define a table?
questions.answer: <table>

questions.question: What is the purpose of the 'for' attribute in a <label> element?
choices: To specify which form element a label is bound to
To define what the label is for
To set the target of the label
To specify the format of the label
questions.answer: To specify which form element a label is bound to

questions.question: Which attribute is used to specify the width of an element?
questions.answer: width
